item.title: About Assumptions in Statistics
item.description: Assumption is a common concept in statistical analysis. For example, we have normality assumption and homoscedasticity assumption in linear regression and ANOVA. Assumptions are not like statistical conclusions in several ways.

item.title: Sensitivity and Specificity
item.description: Sensitivity (True positive) Link to heading = Positive among all true Sensitivity is for describing how sensitive a classifier or test is. Given a “true”, the probability of spotting this “true” is called sensitivity. $$ \text{Sensitivity}=P(\text{positive}|\text{true}) $$ For example, a blood screening is used for spotting a disease. Sensitivity of the blood screening means the probability of getting a positive result when that person is actually sick. A very sensitive blood test will spot almost all sick people and even take healthy people as sick (low specificity).

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description:
Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: About me
item.description: I am a statistician at the Data Analytics Lab (DAL) at the University of Texas at El Paso. The DAL offers a range of services to assist both internal researchers and external clients in the El Paso region. Our services include: Experimental design Data analysis Protocol review Data entry Clinical trials, etc These services are designed to support various research needs and ensure the success of your projects.

item.title: Personal Life
item.description: I am an animal lover. I live with many pets. First, let’s meet my adorable parrotlet Smurf. He is a two year old boy and he can say a few words, such as “Peekaboo”, “Birdie Birdie”, and “Pikachu”. Smurf loves hemp seeds and millet sprays. Parrotlets have tiny body but big personality. They are very smart creatures and not as loud as many other parrots. Smurf likes standing on my shoulder.
